items.headline: US Futures Stabilize Amid Tariff and AI Concerns; Market Sentiment Shifting
items.summary: US stock futures show signs of stabilization on Tuesday, following a significant selloff in the prior session. Market sentiment remains influenced by ongoing concerns regarding rapid advancements in artificial intelligence leading to economic disruption, coupled with uncertainty surrounding US trade policy and escalating geopolitical tensions. Notably, a broader market rotation is underway, with smaller and mid-cap stocks demonstrating strength over the previously dominant mega-cap technology firms. This is not financial advice.

items.statContext: Opened flat to +50 points; closed up 0.47% on Friday

items.headline: Shift in Market Leadership: Small-Caps Outperform Mega-Cap Tech
items.summary: Early 2026 data indicates a significant market rotation, with the equal-weighted S&P 500 (RSP) outperforming the traditional market-cap-weighted S&P 500 (SPX). Small-cap stocks, as represented by the Russell 2000, are showing pronounced strength, suggesting a notable shift in investor capital towards cyclical and defensive sectors and away from the concentrated dominance of mega-cap technology firms.

items.headline: AI Disruption Fears and New Tariffs Continue to Weigh on Markets
items.summary: Concerns over AI-led economic disruption persist, especially impacting software and payment companies, which saw significant losses on Monday. Adding to the anxiety, President Donald Trump immediately imposed a new 10% global tariff on all imports after the Supreme Court struck down his reciprocal tariffs, leading to warnings from Europe about potential jeopardized trade deals.

items.headline: Key Earnings Reports on Tap for Tuesday
items.summary: Several major companies are scheduled to release their earnings reports prior to market open today, February 24, 2026. These include Home Depot, Inc. ($HD), Amer Sports, Inc. ($AS), Expeditors International of Washington, Inc. ($EXPD), Westlake Corporation ($WLK), and Leonardo DRS, Inc. ($DRS). Home Depot's consensus earnings per share forecast is $2.52, representing a 19.49% decrease compared to the same quarter last year.

items.headline: Economic Data Releases Expected Today
items.summary: The economic calendar for February 24, 2026, includes releases such as the FHFA Home Price Index, the Richmond Fed Index, and various Treasury Auctions. Investors will be monitoring these releases for further indications of economic health. Last week's Q4 GDP growth came in at 1.4%, below the 2.5% expectation, reflecting declines in federal and consumer spending.
